cont.entity_a: The machine vibrates excessively, causing instability. Grinding wheels are out of balance, especially the coarse wheel. The grinder vibrates significantly, affecting the plastic shields and causing them to become unscrewed. Multiple wheel combinations were tried, but vibration persisted. Runs smoothly and quietly when mounted on a heavy-duty stand. The grinder stones are fairly well balanced but do vibrate slightly. Vibration issues out of the box; resolved by removing the medium grit wheel. Moderate vibration likely due to inexpensive grinding wheels. Excessive vibration caused by out-of-balance wheels.
cont.entity_b: Feels well built with no vibration or noise. No vibration and very little noise. Does not need to be bolted down due to no vibration. Heavy and quiet with little vibration. Requires better quality wheels to reduce vibration.

cont.entity_a: Plenty of power with a slight vibration. The tabletop grinder is powerful and continues spinning for a minute after turning off. The grinder is powerful and does not stall with heavy metal grinding.
cont.entity_b: Powerful grinder that does not bog down under pressure. Powerful 1 hp induction motor with fast startup.

cont.entity_a: Runs smoothly and quietly when mounted on a heavy-duty stand.
cont.entity_b: Feels well built with no vibration or noise. No vibration and very little noise. Heavy and quiet with little vibration.

cont.entity_a: Easy assembly and mounting to workbench. Assembly instructions could be improved.
cont.entity_b: Some packaging and assembly issues noted.

cont.entity_a: The product's packaging does not conceal its contents, increasing theft risk.
cont.entity_b: Some packaging and assembly issues noted.

cont.entity_a: Installation on a JET pedestal mounted to a concrete floor reduces vibration. Wire wheel installation can be dangerous at high speeds.
The grinder can get extremely hot and lose torque over time.
cont.entity_b: Heavy duty parts with no cheap sheet metal.

cont.entity_a: Quality control at DeWalt is questionable due to wobbling issues. Concerns about missing toolrest mounting hardware.
cont.entity_b: Some vibration due to poor quality control on the shaft.

cont.entity_a: The company was not helpful with resolving issues, suggesting a return to the retailer. Customer service replaced defective parts quickly.
Takes about 5 seconds to reach full RPM and 2 minutes to stop. Issues with motor seizing upon arrival. Runs smoothly and quietly when mounted on a heavy-duty stand.
cont.entity_b: Runs true with ported outlets for waste transport. Requires significant pressure to slow down.
High price but justified for daily use. Powerful and sturdy with a good price.
Tool rests are small and work light is not standard.
